alert.note: Alert for Atoka; Coal; Hughes; Pontotoc (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued February 15 at 10:15PM CST until February 15 at 11:15PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Coal County in southeastern Oklahoma... East central Pontotoc County in east central Oklahoma... Northeastern Atoka County in southeastern Oklahoma... Southeastern Hughes County in southeastern Oklahoma... * Until 1115 PM CST. * At 1015 PM CST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 5 miles east of Ada to 5 miles southwest of Tupelo to 3 miles west of Bromide, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Coalgate, Lehigh, Tupelo, Stuart, Bromide, Gerty, Centrahoma, Clarita, Olney, Wardville, Phillips, Chockie and northern Atoka Reservoir. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
